protocol.title: Bosch IVT Protocol. HTTP is local. XMPP is cloud!

easycontrol_protocol.title: EasyControl connection
easycontrol_protocol.description: XMPP connects directly to your device on the local network. Cloud login uses your Bosch account and works remotely.

pointtapi_device_id.title: Your EasyControl serial number
pointtapi_device_id.description: Enter your device serial number (with or without dashes). You'll find it on the label on the device or in the Bosch EasyControl app under Settings → Device info.

pointtapi_oauth_open.title: Log in with your Bosch account
pointtapi_oauth_open.description:
Click **[this link]({auth_url})** to open the Bosch login page in a new browser tab and sign in with your Bosch account.

After logging in, your browser will show a "Cannot open page" error — **that is expected**. Leave that tab open and click **Submit** below.

pointtapi_oauth.title: Complete sign-in
pointtapi_oauth.description:
Paste the callback URL below. It starts with `com.bosch.tt.dashtt.pointt://app/login?code=`.

**Having trouble?** Some browsers don't show the URL clearly after login. Use the `run_playwright.sh` helper script from the repository — it opens a browser, you log in once, and it prints the exact URL to paste here. See `POINTTAPI_OAUTH_TESTING.md` for instructions.

error.invalid_device_id: Device ID must be digits only (serial number without dashes).
error.oauth_callback_empty: Please paste the URL from the browser address bar.
error.oauth_callback_invalid: Could not read the login code from that URL. Make sure you copied the full URL after the page showed "Cannot open page".
error.oauth_token_failed: Failed to complete sign-in with Bosch. The login code may have expired — please try again from the start.

abort.faulty_credentials: Bad user credentials or wrong IP
abort.reauth_invalid: Re-authentication only applies to POINTTAPI entries.

data.optimistic_mode: Use optimistic mode for some functions (currently CT200 Operation mode set).
